etymology.description: 子(子) (zǐ, "child") + 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") = child under a roof -> representation of how children would learn to write characters inside a house -> character
etymology.interpretation: The character 字(zì, "character") combines 子(zǐ, "child") and 宀(mián, "roof") to depict a child learning to write under the protection of a roof. This makes intuitive sense as learning and education traditionally took place at home.

examples.chinese: 这个字很漂亮(這個字很漂亮)。
每个字都有故事(每個字都有故事)，蕴含着历史智慧(蘊含著歷史智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè zì dōu yǒu gùshì, yùnhán zhe lìshǐ zhìhuì.
examples.english: Every character has a story, containing the wisdom of history.
